metadata.dc:author: García, A
del Carmen Marquetti, M
Navarro, A
Bisset, J
metadata.dc:description: The larval density of Anopheles (N) albimanus Wiedemann, 1821, is linked with rice phenology in the two crops of the year (summer and winter). It was determined that a higher density agrees with the second stage of the vegetative cycle of the culture named beginning of shooting processes and the formation of the panicular primordium. The number of anopheline larvae was higher in the summer.
metadata.dc:title: Estudio de la densidad larval de Anopheles (N) albimanus Wiedemann, 1821 en relación con la fenología del arroz Oryza sativa (Linnaeus).
[Larval density of Anopheles (N) albimanus Wiedemann, 1821 in relation to phenology of Oryza sativa (Linnaeus) rice].
